description:
Heading to #Google #Next23 next week and then following that with a 3 day #ultrarunning training camp in #Moab over Labor Day weekend. It should be quite the contrast!

Planning 3 days, 92.79 mi, 17,123 ft of climbing and focusing on the Abajo and La Sal portions of the course. No idea on how long it will take to complete but should be fun!

#running #training #ultramarathon

https://justin.poehnelt.com/posts/moab-240-training-camp/

Because of the following, I have removed all coworkers as #Strava followers.

1. Running is an important part of my mental health
2. I sometimes choose to run during the workday
3. I feel guilty when my coworkers "see" me running during the "workday"

#mentalhealth #running #work

Trail racing photos are almost always bad.

I was in two of them at: https://www.taosnews.com/sports/outdoors/enchanted-forest-race-puts-trail-runners-to-the-test/article_b4a07eab-abce-58d1-a6d7-ab5701ff993d.html

I actually like the second one here. The first one is meh, but at least I'm not stuffing my face with food or something. üòÉ In 100 milers, it often is awkward because I'm exhausted/walking and then I run a couple hundred feet for the photographer and force a half smile.

#trailrunning #photography #ultramarathon #ultrarunning

description:
My desire to #automate all the things has manifested a Chrome Extension for an internal tool. I'm bad with manual tasks and this extension provides a bunch of composite actions that saves me several clicks and manually entering text.

#chrome #extension

Probably estimate about 50 miles/day. Drops and/or support at Wolf Creek Pass and Molas Lake. The middle third would be about 100 miles with bail points to Cimarrona or Rio Grand Reservoir. The last third is the most accessible from Molas to Junction Creek along the Colorado Trail.
This blew up on Reddit üòÑ

media:content.media:description: Stats for a Reddit post titled "Race Director Stole My Win" showing 80,000 views.

description:
I went for a run in the South San Juan Wilderness this past weekend and now I really want to #fastpack this route, https://www.strava.com/routes/3121940898131928282.

I'm calling it the San Juan Horseshoe, 230 ish miles on the #ContinentalDivideTrail and #ColoradoTrail from Cumbres to Durango.

Just need to convince my coach and partner! I did a subset of this from Wolf Creek Pass to Highland Mary Lakes near Silverton in 2020 and want to get back there.

#trailrunning #fkt #ultrarunning #wilderness #colorado

media:content.media:description: A South San Juan Wilderness sign sitting on the alpine tundra along a little used trail above tree line with snow covered mountains in the distance.
A map and elevation profile of a route through the San Juan Mountains of Colorado. The elevation profile shows much of the route near 12000 feet.

description:
I won a race this weekend. Two runners made a wrong turn on the final climb but were given the "official" win even though they missed about 4 miles of the trail marathon...

https://justin.poehnelt.com/posts/a-race-win-was-stolen-from-me/

#race #marathon #running #ultramarathon #wtf #trailrunning

And I ended up winning ü•áafter the two guys ahead me made a wrong turn. I was off the course record by just three minutes and I had some bonus miles of my own. But I turned around and backtracked to where I left the course... Probably lost about ten minutes in extra miles and navigation.

This was my first official marathon distance race! 4:22, 5k feet of climbing, some poor footing and no trail tread in parts to slow things down.

#marathon #trailrunning #race

https://strava.app.link/7DFb5kDVPBb

What are the best accounts to follow in the fediverse for rust?

#rustlang #rust #programming

After taking 20 seconds(~15%) off a #Strava segment I have run probably 50 times this year, I had to sign up for another #trail #running #race.

This will be my first race at the #marathon distance! According to Strava, about 5000 feet of climbing, üìà, half of the climbing is up a ski run.

https://geminiadventures.com/run/enchanted-forest
https://www.strava.com/routes/3118725741336709564

Probably a good distance to keep me from breaking down so I can keep with my training plan until #Moab240 üò±
The daily #hydroponics harvest. I've mostly given up on an outdoor garden in #Colorado. #gardening
No clouds today for #Hardrock100. Heading up from Little Molas to Putnam to watch the runners come through.

Still 80F+ here in Durango at 7:30pm! ü•µ

I bet the #Hardrock100 runners are struggling!

Might need to head to higher elevations and be a #HobbyRunner on the live stream tomorrow üòÉ. Last year I went up from Little Molas Lake to see the entire field at the top of the first climb.

#trailrunning #running #ultrarunning

Feels good getting some of my neglected #opensource libraries back to a maintained state. Keeping up with dependencies, build patterns, best practices etc is overwhelming.

https://github.com/jpoehnelt/secrets-sync-action
https://github.com/jpoehnelt/semantic-release-replace-plugin

It's been so long since I gave a talk for work or fun! Now I have upcoming sessions at:

- No longer doing this one: https://cloud.withgoogle.com/next (work - #auth with #Google #Workspace)
- https://westslopestartupweek.com (fun - static sites, #eleventy, #alpinejs, etc)

#Next23 #conferences

Playing whack-a-mole with the #rust compiler is both frustrating and a great #learning experience.

Currently combining a MVC pattern having an `tokio::sync::mpsc` channel for the TUI and plexamp(world) events to the controller with a `tokio::sync::broadcast` to get the model back to the view/tasks.

https://justin.poehnelt.com/posts/rust-whack-a-mole/

Exploring #rust and creating a terminal ui for #plexamp with ratatui and tokio. Seems like a proper challenge to learn the language and the intricacies around async/threads/tasks, borrowing/moving, locks, etc.

So far I have tokio spawning tasks for updating the Model of MVC to keep track of all the plexamp players on the network. This required porting some python(https://python-plexapi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/plexapi/gdm.html) code I found documenting the multicast protocol used by #Plex.
Learning a new programming language is much different today with Copilot and other Gen AI tools! It enables me to skip the earlier steps of understanding the language for better or worse.

Also made my #blog #GitHub repo public yesterday. Don't judge too harshly! üòÉ Currently 85 on #Eleventy leaderboard for #Speedlify.

https://github.com/jpoehnelt/blog
https://www.11ty.dev/speedlify/justin-poehnelt-com/

Recently played around with email magic links for a login page using Cloudflare Pages, Cloudflare Functions, and Sendgrid on a static Eleventy site with AlpineJS.

https://justin.poehnelt.com/posts/email-magiclink-with-cloudflare-functions/

#cloudflare #serverless #auth #passwordless #alpinejs #eleventy
Some of my worst #running injuries happen in near falls on the trail when I torque my body in weird ways to avoid hitting the dirt/rocks. Messed up some cartilage in my ribcage this time!
#Desert #flowers in #Utah
Beautiful day on sunset beach. #beach

Normally it's smoke this time of year in southwest Colorado. Today, it's massive clouds of yellow pollen from the Ponderosa trees.

Aside: the GenerativeAI search results have been useful for many of my recent searches.

#pollen #trees #colorado #genai

I worked from a public space in the first time in what seems like forever while waiting on service for my truck. Ska Brewing of Durango, CO is great!

Also my first drink in nearly two months with lunch! üç∫ (I had the Checkered Future IPA)

Normally this would mess up my heart rate variability (HRV), but it still hasn't really been stable since running my last ultramarathon 2.5 weeks ago.

#Durango #beer #ultramarathon

The greatest challenge in making sense of all the feedback... distilling the bugs and feature requests into a variety of reports for different stakeholders. Should probably use the LLM for that too!

#devrel #llm

So much easier to do much of this now, compared to implementing this a few years ago: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cviu.2019.07.010

That used BigTable and multiple buckets to approximately search the vector space. Now you can use Google Cloud Vertex AI Matching Engine: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/matching-engine/overview

#gcp #vertexAI

I had to write my first SQL queries in a couple years and I think I still remember how it works. Also Python... what are these type things?! üòÄ

All of this is because I'm doing some data analysis of feature requests, bugs, etc. Some fun stuff to play with:

- vector similarity search
- tfidf as a secondary search
- LLMs for a bunch of steps, extracting lists, some categorization, etc
- random forest for categorization

#llm #devrel #ml #sql #python #data

A week after running a 100 mile ultramarathon:

HRV: 44 (-30)
Resting Heart Rate: 48 (+11)
Resting Respiratory Rate: 13 (+1)

It is really amazing how long some of these activities take to recover from! I need more sleep and to keep eating!

* These numbers of course are relative to me and should not really be compared across individuals.

#running #fitness #ultrarunning #ultramarathon

I survived the Canyons 100 mile, barely! Never have my feet been so destroyed in a 100 mile course üò¨. Got my 8 stones though!

https://www.strava.com/activities/8983865859

If your podcast promotes athletic greens or inside tracker, you automatically lose a ton of credibility for me.
Found a pair of Mule deer antlers on my #run!

The hardest part of #DevRel for me is creating samples for new APIs and features when there is more friction for the developers than there should be. This developer empathy leads to two outcomes:

1. proactively anticipating the pain points and documenting them for teams owning the APIs and features
2. becoming demoralized

It's a constant balancing act. It can be exhausting.

Prediction: LLMs will be commodities in six months and the value will move to integrations within existing apps and as add-ons, extensions, and plugins.

Disclaimer: I work at Google but with no specific inside knowledge about LLMs.

#chatgpt #bard #llm #future

Some planning and splits for the upcoming Canyons 100 mile race by UTMB:

https://justin.poehnelt.com/posts/2023-canyons-100-miles-by-utmb-planning-splits/

I'm aiming for a 24 hour finish!

#canyons100 #utmb

I'm running the Canyons 100 mile race in April. I did some parsing of the start list to get the UltraSignup ranks of the runners and it looks to be a quite competitive race.

- I took the highest rank for names when multiple runners
- Does not account for runners with fewer results by top performances

#ultramarathon #utmb #canyons100 #running

And I'm in for the #Moab240 race in October!

description:
Looking back at my #running in #2022 and the races I have planned so far for #2023! Two registrations for #ultramarathons will probably become 5+ in the next few weeks as signups open!

https://justin.poehnelt.com/posts/running-in-2022-and-2023/

https://ultrasignup.com/results_participant.aspx?fname=Justin&lname=Poehnelt
Still kind of wish I had a treadmill for #running workout sessions. The run in the #snow today felt like 1 step back for every 2 steps forward!
Got some new #running shoes for #winter, the La Sportiva Cyklon Cross GTX! Wrote up a quick review: https://justin.poehnelt.com/posts/la-sportiva-cyklon-review/
Still some healing going on... about 2 weeks post #tattoo. Will also fade a bit. Looks a lot more interesting when it is dynamic and I'm moving my arm.
The worst time to get a sleeve #tattoo is in the winter because you can't show it off! #maps #running
Feels good to get the weekly #running mileage back, but six inches of fresh snow today is going to make it a little more difficult until about March. ‚òπÔ∏è ‚ùÑÔ∏è

media:content.media:description: Graph showing increase in weekly mileage over the last three months.

description: A neighbor expects me to greet them during my daily #running workout. I am almost always in a state of mental or physical focus and not in the mood. WDYT? (also an #introvert)

Running at night in the snow üå®Ô∏è is so hypnotizing. Another 15 miles in! Trying to build some base before there is a couple feet of snow on this same trail in another month. Going to try and crank it up to 70-90 mpw.

https://www.strava.com/activities/8217469652

#trailrunning #run #workout #winteriscoming

media:content.media:description: Snow flurries at night on a trail. Snow flurries create long streaks across the image as they reflect off the head lamp.

description:
The newest developer relations task is creating snippets targeted to AI models such as GitHub CoPilot that demonstrate best practices, but are not necessarily consumed in documentation or directly by developers.

#copilot #devrel #ai #automation #software #github
Developer marketing will also be better with a real customer in the announcement blog/video/etc. #devrel #marketing

#hottake #devrel as customer zero is an anti pattern that doesn't scale. It's better to have a real release process for feedback from actual customers. I am not an actual customer and my use will not reflect that of actual customers.

If you need this step as part of an API sanity check, your engineering practices are probably lacking and probably handled better through an API guild pattern. Devrel can participate here but should not be the lead in this process. #customerzero
My weekly #running mileage directly correlates to the number of creative ideas I have for #work. I should do long runs midweek. #creativity #thinking #brainstorming
40F and a light rain üåßÔ∏è means I get the trails to my today üôÇ #run #trailrun #coloradosprings

IDRAC to the rescue! I'm going to need to take a shower after using this crusty Java interface.

me != a #systems engineer

I can't believe I don't have an old VGA cable in a box somewhere. Trying to setup a new server in my homelab.

#homelab

Developer experience becomes increasingly important in a time of tightening budgets as it not only translates into happier developers, but also more productive developers.

#devrel #devx

Chronic Training Load (CTL) is such a useless measure of #running #fitness as the aerobic base is built over much longer than a 6 week window.

I could easily go for many hours at this pace even though I have barely run 50 miles over the last month and my #Strava and #TrainingPeaks #CTL shows me as being at the lowest fitness level compared to the last couple years.

The latest #KoopCast, https://www.jasonkoop.com/podcast, on subjective vs object training feedback also discussed this.
Ended up with a nice and slow long #run. 20 miles at 11:00 minute pace on trail.

description: Beautiful day for a #run in #Colorado.

#introduction I'm a software engineer currently in a developer relations role at #Google and loving it.

When I'm not coding I'm probably running in the mountains of southwest #Colorado. Previously lived in #SantaFe and #Flagstaff and worked with satellite imagery at #USGS and #DescartesLabs.

#devrel #webdev #frontend #typescript #nodejs #automation #maps #geospatial #opensource

#hydroponics #gardening #vegan

#runner #trailrunning #ultrarunner #ultramarathons

#Durango #Weminuche
It's been a little over a month since I DNFed at the #Moab240 around mile 120ish. I can't wait to run another #ultramarathon and I've decided I want to try the Moab race again next year!

Three years of #running in the San Juan Mountains of #Colorado. Lots of trails to cover still! Week and a half until the #Hardrock100 lottery! ü§û

I made a little toy project for finding users across Mastodon and the Fediverse.

It lets you quickly build and download a CSV of matching users using text search such as "dogs AND !cats". Some example queries below.

#devops: https://mamddom.com/?q=%23devops
#climate: https://mamddom.com/?q=%23climate
#biking: https://mamddom.com/?q=%23biking
#writing AND #scifi: https://mamddom.com/?q=%23writing+AND+%23scifi
#fediverse: https://mamddom.com/?q=%23fediverse

Check it out! Ignores all accounts having #nobot. Still fixing some of the backend.

#FollowFriday
memory leaks are fun and #software development is hard. I think it is from an #opensource image library and not my code ü§£

Just implemented a prototype #Rust, #Rocket, #Tailwind app using Tera templates. I think I am getting the hang of the Rust syntax and patterns after only a couple hours. I might give up some of the HMR from modern web frameworks, but the ops end of the app should be interesting to explore.

And blocking birdsite on the home router! üòé

#unifi #birdsite #delete
#birdsite #delete with #NextDNS.
#birdsite #delete

Yes

Content warning: politics

I'm for https://ballotpedia.org/Colorado_Proposition_123,_Dedicate_State_Income_Tax_Revenue_to_Fund_Housing_Projects_Initiative_(2022), but can we just tax the unoccupied second homes instead of trying to manipulate a subset of the housing market through these measures. I would also prefer actual families as neighbors instead of #Texans that show up for a few weeks a year (or a few days a year).

If these empty houses weren't viable as investments, the housing supply would immediately see a huge increase and affect housing availability at all price points.

#Colorado #AffordableHousing

description:
The #AGPL license is a blocker for me to contribute üòû

https://mastodon.thbps.com/@jpoehnelt/109306945726471997
If you are going to #syndicate your content, please don't feed the billionaire narcissist with your content.

So far in my switch to #Mastodon and the #fediverse

- Everyone I follow is intentional.
- I only see trending content if I go looking.
- No sponsored shit in my face.
- Content is high quality.

Highly recommend and look forward to learning more and contributing back to the #opensource that powers all of it. Gonna have to learn some #ruby! üòÄ

#fediverse #tip

RSS feeds are built-in! üéâ

https://mastodon.thbps.com/@jpoehnelt.rss
I think I have come to the conclusion that I want to run the #Moab240 next year after failing to finish this year!
